title: Testing Quantile Forecast Optimality. (arXiv:2302.02747v2 [econ.EM] UPDATED)
abstract: Quantile forecasts made across multiple horizons have become an important output of many financial institutions, central banks and international organisations. This paper proposes misspecification tests for such quantile forecasts that assess optimality over a set of multiple forecast horizons and/or quantiles. The tests build on multiple Mincer-Zarnowitz quantile regressions cast in a moment equality framework. Our main test is for the null hypothesis of autocalibration, a concept which assesses optimality with respect to the information contained in the forecasts themselves. We provide an extension that allows to test for optimality with respect to larger information sets and a multivariate extension. Importantly, our tests do not just inform about general violations of optimality, but may also provide useful insights into specific forms of sub-optimality. translated_title: 测试分位数预测的优化性
translated_abstract: 在许多金融机构、中央银行和国际组织中，跨多个预测时段的分位数预测已成为重要的输出。本文提出了一种针对这种分位数预测的错误规范检验，该检验评估多个预测时段和/或分位数下的优化性。该检验建立在多个Mincer-Zarnowitz分位数回归基础上，采用矩等式框架。我们的主要检验是针对自动校准的零假设，这一概念评估了预测本身所包含的信息。我们提供了一种扩展，可以测试相对较大的信息集和多元扩展的优化性。重要的是，我们的测试不仅可以提供有关优化性的一般违反情况的信息，还可以提供有关特定形式的次优性的有用洞见。模拟研究调查了我们的测试的有限样本性能，以及两个对金融收益的实证应用。
tldr: 本文提出了一种针对分位数预测的优化性测试方法，可以在多个预测时段和/或分位数下评估预测的优化性。测试基于多个Mincer-Zarnowitz分位数回归，并利用矩等式框架。模拟研究和实证应用进一步验证了该方法的有效性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a test for the optimality of quantile forecasts that can evaluate their performance across multiple forecast horizons and/or quantiles. The test is based on multiple Mincer-Zarnowitz quantile regressions and a moment equality framework. Simulation study and empirical applications demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method.
